entry.value: Metanode creates correlation coefficients clustermap (hierarchically-clustered heatmap) on selected columns. The central part consists of correlation coefficients for each column pair displayed as heatmap. Plus coefficiennts are clustered using hierarchical clustering where columns with highest correlation should cluster together.%%00010%%00010You can select correlation coefficient type to be computed.%%00010%%00010Correlation coefficients can be displayed using different colormaps to highlight the differences. Colormap center (e.g. what number should be visualized as centered color in the concrete colormap) can be manually selected, otherwise it will be computed automaticaly and colormap will start at minmum and end at maximum number. Used colormap names can be checked here: https://matplotlib.org/users/colormaps.html.%%00010%%00010Cluster analysis has these two settings:%%00010- distance metric - how the distance between the two columns should be calculated, e.g. euclidian, cityblock see e.g. https://docs.scipy.org/doc/scipy/reference/generated/scipy.spatial.distance.pdist.html for more details%%00010%%00010- cluster method - method for calculating the distances between clusters, e.g. complete, average; see e.g. https://docs.scipy.org/doc/scipy/reference/generated/scipy.cluster.hierarchy.linkage.html for more details%%00010%%00010Note: any data preprocessing (like transformation, normalization) should be done prior the metanode usage!%%00010%%00010Version: 0.2.1%%00010Contact person: David Potesil (david.potesil@ceitec.muni.cz)
input table containing columns to be selected for visualization
